text: Zuma and Trancas Canyons are an area of Federal parkland to the west of Malibu, California. It lies within the Santa Monica Mountains National Recreation Area and is the largest piece of Federal parkland in the NRA. Zuma Canyon contains a number of trails for hikers, of varying severity,Zuma Canyon Trail at hikespeak.com and is the home of a range of wildlife, including the wrentit, known as the "Voice of the Chaparral".Zuma and Trancas Canyons at nps.gov The park's eastern boundary is marked by Kanan Dume Road (county route N-9) and the north end of the parkland is crossed by the Backbone Trail, a 67 mile pathway through the Santa Monica Mountains.The name zuma is derived from a Chumash word meaning "abundance". ==References== Category:Santa Monica Mountains National Recreation Area Category:Parks in Los Angeles County, California
title: Zuma and Trancas Canyons
